abstracts.cdata!:
This sector assistance review not only
            assesses the outcome, sustainability, and institutional
            development of World Bank to the urban water supply and
            wastewater sector, but also tracks the impact of assistance
            in financing reform, regulatory reforms including tariff
            regulation, institutional reforms, and reforms to promote
            private service provision. OED rates the outcome of the
            Bank's assistance, moderately satisfactory, with
            sustainability likely because of strong government support.
            Institutional development impact is rated modest. Both Bank
            and Borrower performances are considered satisfactory. The
            report makes these six recommendations: 1) Demand management
            should always precede supply increases and investments in
            wastewater treatment. 2) Set tariffs to reflect future total
            costs and create incentives for billing and collecting those
            higher tariffs. 3) Build and support autonomous utilities.
            4) Enhance the level of self-financing. 5) Mitigate risk and
            improve efficiency through regulation. 6) Enable greater
            private sector participation.
